Key Match Events: England conceded their biggest ever ODI total, falling to their biggest ever defeat
Jos Buttler admits bowling first was 'potentially' a mistake
WICKET! Willey c Rabada b Ngidi 12 (England 103-8)
WICKET! Rashid c Hendricks b Coetzee (England 84-7)
WICKET! Buttler c de Kock b Coetzee 15 (England 67-5)
WICKET! Malan c de Kock b Jansen 6 (England 24-3)
WICKET! Root c Miller b Jansen 2 (England 23-2)
WICKET! Bairstow c Van der Dussen b Ngidi 10 (England 18-1)
Klaasen shuffles across and loses his leg stump. An astonishing innings and the ground rises to him.

Klaasen is felled by a Wood bouncer, flat on the floor for a couple of minutes. But, somehow, he is back: reaches his hundred by flaying a low full toss for six and pulling a wide one from Wood for four.
Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler admits bowling first was 'potentially' a mistake
England win the toss and will bowl!
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler: 'It’s incredibly disappointing. We came in with hopes of playing well but were well beaten.'
Victorious captain Aiden Markram speaks: 'It was a fantastic all-round performance, I couldn’t have asked for a bigger effort.'
Matthew Mott confirms that Reece Topley has a suspected cracked finger but Jofra Archer will NOT be considered to replace him
Miscellaneous Highlights: The heat and humidity will drop – not sure about the pollution – but England have already spent 50 overs in the field.
South Africa were astonishing – and, best of all, their bowlers have just spent the last three hours in air-conditioned comfort.
The pitch is flat and the boundaries are short.
Others: The construction particle matter is even more dangerous than smoke.
The ICC must mandate masks for players to protect their health and wellbeing!
England need a record run chase here with their World Cup hopes dangling by a thread.
A torrent of emails in my inbox towards the end, apologies that I haven’t been able to read/use them all.
